text: The 1875–1876 season was the fifth season of competitive football in England. The only international match was the fifth match between England and Scotland. ==International== {| class="wikitable" !Date !Venue !Opponents !Score !Scotland scorers |- |4 March 1876 |Hamilton Crescent, Glasgow (A) | Scotland |0–3Scotland v England, 4 March 1876. 11v11.com. Retrieved 27 June 2013. Archived 2013-06-30. |William Muir MacKinnon (8), Henry McNeil(12), Thomas Highet |} According to Philip Gibbons, "the England side tended to be chosen on availability rather than skill alone." England struggled throughout the game, which saw the home team run out winners by three goals to nil.Scotland 3 – England 0; 4 March 1876 (Match summary). englandstats.com. Retrieved 20 June 2013Report on Scotland v England match. London Hearts Supporters Club. Retrieved 20 June 2013 In May 2008, a photograph of the 1876 England team was discovered in the archives of the Derby City Council Local Studies Library. Edgar Field had sent the photograph to the Derbyshire Football Express, and the picture was used in an article published on the 50th anniversary of the match. This picture came to light in May and is believed to be the earliest known picture of an England football team. ==Honours== {| class="wikitable" |- !Competition !Winner |- |FA Cup||Wanderers (3*) |} Notes = Number in parentheses is the times that club has won that honour. * indicates new record for competition ==References== ==External links== * *
title: 1875–76 in English football
